The magnitude of the expected loss is estimated at ₽ 1.08 trillion for the period 2020–2050 or ₽ 36.26 bln in average annual terms

With the average change, the magnitude of the expected loss is estimated at  ₽ 1.08 trillion for the period 2020–2050 or ₽ 36.26 bln in average annual terms, which is equivalent to 0.29% of the GRP in 2018 prices.
With the maximum change of permafrost temperature and thaw depth, the expected loss increases threefold, to ₽ 3.37 trillion for the entire period, or by more than  ₽ 112 bln on average per year.
With the maximum change of permafrost temperature and thaw depth, the expected loss increases threefold, to ₽ 3.37 trillion for the entire period, or by more than  ₽ 112 bln on average per year.
Acceleration of housing construction by 50% in relation to the current level, which will lead to an increase in the total area of housing to 119.6 mln square meters by 2050.
The total cost of the housing stock will be ₽ 7.2 trillion in 2018 prices
The expected loss from permafrost thawing and degradation is estimated in the range from ₽ 500 bln to ₽ 3.36 trillion, depending on the changes in permafrost temperature and thaw depth.
